metadata.Title: CVE-2023-26590 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A floating point exception vulnerability was found in sox, in the lsx_aiffstartwrite function at sox/src/aiff.c:622:58. This flaw can lead to a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-26590` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox2 - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
sox - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: ebarretto> From Debian: Same fix as for CVE-2022-31650

criterions.comment: sox package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2').
